alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 9:14PM EST until December 12 at 3:55AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River Mississinewa River .Rainfall since Friday of about one inch brought 5-day rainfall totals up to around two inches...which has lead to localized flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Mississinewa River banks about one mile east of Ridgeville and in other areas begin to overflow at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Saturday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.0 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 400 AM EST.
